A C-section rate of less than 5% suggests 
that women in need of this life-saving procedure 
are not able to access it. Lack of access is an 
important contributor to high maternal and 
perinatal death rates in resource-limited settings.
C-section requires skilled staff and 
adequately supplied facilities, both of which
